dedication.title: Dedication
dedication.para: A Dedication is a section at the very beginning of a book (before any other body matter) containing a tribute to something (frequently someone) in connection with the writing or publication of the Book.

preface.title: Preface with a very long title that will need to wrap, I expect
preface.para: Preface is a preface or forward in a Book. The Preface element may appear more than once and should be used for all introductory chapter-like material. For example, a Book might have both a Foreward and an Introduction. Both should be tagged as Prefaces in DocBook.

section.title: Section Level 1
section.para: A section directly inside a chapter.

formalpara.title: FormalPara
formalpara.para: formalpara elements describe a paragraph that has a title.

section.title: Section Level 2
section.para: A section nested within 1 other section.

section.title: Section Level 3
section.para: A section nested 2 deep within other sections.

section.title: Section Level 4
section.para: A section nested 3 deep within other sections.

section.title: Section Level 5
section.para: A section nested 4 deep within other sections.

sect1.title: Sect1
sect1.para: A sect1 directly inside a chapter.

sect2.title: Sect2
sect2.para: A sect2 nested in a sect1.

sect3.title: Sect3
sect3.para: A sect3 nested in a sect2.

sect4.title: Sect4
sect4.para: A sect4 nested in a sect3.

sect5.title: Sect5
sect5.para: A sect5 nested in a sect4.

preface.title: Preface to an Empty Part
preface.para: This book 'part' doesn't actually contain any chapters.

glossary.title: Glossary
glossary.para: A Glossary contains a collection of terms and brief descriptions or definitions of those terms.

glossdef.para: A Glossary must have some content

colophon.title: Colophon
colophon.para: A Colophon, if present, almost always occurs at the very end of a book. It contains factual information about the book, especially about its production, and includes details about typographic style, the fonts used, the paper used, and perhaps the binding method of the book.
